message: did pretty much nothing, since I don't have a valentine this year

Well, @mistahsnart and I spent the evening at home: I made steak fajitas, homemade pico de gallo and guacamole. We ate by lamplight watching tv. We are the epitome of romance. *snort*  What about you?
We didn't do much yesterday, but had an early Valentine's dinner of lobsters on Saturday
I sat on the couch with @blogkitten eating steak fajitas, homemade pico de gallo and guacamole.
We did an early Valentine dinner at Ruth's Chris. Gotta say - I wasn't terribly impressed.
"just did spent"? Boy, I sure earned my English degree.
Valentine's Day is kind of high-pressure for people that have been "official" for less than a week...so we just did spent a day in SF over the weekend. It was enough for me. :)
stayed home with my new friend pneumonia
I attended the wedding of some really good friends.

Went to a tapas place in Brooklyn where I had an entire Cornish hen; this was a bit terrifying for me because I've never even eaten at a table that had a whole turkey on it before (Chinese Thanksgiving mostly involves duck and chicken, cut into little pieces); questioned my carnivorous-ness but ultimately ate all of it, it was scrumptious though I kept wondering if I had accidentally eaten any chicken organs which was an unappetizing thought. HOWEVER, there was an amazing chocolate cheesecake and a really good appetizer so I was very happy.
And of course y'all can file that under TMI, and I will slink away and go back to work.
Worked late like @spencer (though it was around 11p when I left the office). Valentine's Day was really during the weekend. I assume you just all forgot about this. ;-)
We went to Black Swan and dinner on Saturday. We didn't do anything on Valentine's day
